repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: it stands to
            reason that a small project such as this one could have
            readily been integrated into an ongoing operation. The
            emergency nature of these interventions, however, combined
            with the complexity of the topics involving multiple
            agencies and ministries as stakeholders require a high level
            of coordination to avoid 'turf battles' and to
            ensure the full ownership by all. Albeit expensive in
            supervision proportionally to loan size these small stand
            alone projects with dedicated implementation
            responsibilities seem to have better outcomes and
            cooperation across the sectors than merged operations. The
            human and veterinarian health sectors need to come closer
            and link on the basis of good cooperation, mutual trust and
            benefit at all levels and resisting turf battles. These
            sectors cannot function on their own in the areas of joint
            interest, particularly in the resolution of problems they
            have in common, such as zoonoses, but also to track
            evolution of epidemic outbreaks and cross species infections
            and monitoring.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina is to
            minimize the threat posed to humans and the poultry industry
            by Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) infection and
            other zoonoses, by enhancing animal and human health
            infectious disease response and control capacities. The
            changes are: (a) to reallocate the funds originally
            allocated to the Poultry Compensation Funds (PCF), i.e.
            SDR200, 000 per entity, for the purposes of influenza
            prevention, preparedness, and planning. The Federation of
            Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBiH) has requested to reallocate
            the funds to purchase respirators for intensive care units
            (ICU), and the Republika Srpska to improve animal disease
            tracking systems, and purchase personal protection equipment
            and seasonal vaccines; and (b) to extend the closing date by
            six months, to provide additional time to carry out civil
            works for the Sarajevo Veterinary Faculty Avian Influenza
            National Reference Laboratory (Stup) and the Sarajevo
            Hospital's Kosevo Clinical Center Viral Laboratory
            (Kosevo). This will be the first extension of the closing date.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Avian Influenza and human pandemic
            preparedness and response project for Bosnia and Herzegovina
            aims to minimize the threat posed to humans and the poultry
            industry by the Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI)
            infection and other zoonoses, by enhancing both animal and
            human health infectious disease response and control
            capacities. To achieve this, three areas will be supported
            by the project: prevention, preparedness and planning; and
            response and containment. Achieving these goals will
            contribute to diminishing the burden o f disease and loss of
            productivity, limiting the regional spread of HPAI, and
            enhancing economic and social prospects at the national,
            regional, and global levels.

docna.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Avian Influenza
            Preparedness Project
